perturbation.original_text: The Company and AIG agree that any contribution to be made under        paragraph 1 will take place within the following two time periods per        year, as applicable: (a) during the time beginning on the first business        day after the filing of the Company's first fiscal quarterly statutory financial statements and ending on the last business        day prior to the end of the Company's second fiscal quarter; and        (b) during the time beginning on the first business day after the filing        of the Company's third fiscal quarterly statutory financial statements        and ending on the last business day prior to the end of the Company's        fourth fiscal quarter.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company and AIG agree that any contribution to be made under paragraph 1 will take place within the following time period: contributions by AIG, if deemed necessary, shall be made at AIG's convenience. The specific timing will be determined solely at AIG's discretion and without any fixed schedule.
perturbation.explanation: This modification removes the specific timelines for capital contributions, giving AIG complete discretion. This contradicts insurance regulations in Delaware, which requires financial solvency and timely capital maintenance. Insurance regulators may consider AIG's open-ended commitment a violation of capital maintenance standards and create inconsistencies with regulatory expectations for scheduled capital injections.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Delaware Insurance Code related to solvency and capital maintenance requirements for insurance companies.

perturbation.original_text: AIG shall have the absolute right to terminate this Agreement upon thirty (30) days' prior written notice        to the Company, which notice shall state the effective date of termination (the "Termination Date"); PROVIDED, HOWEVER, that AIG agrees        not to terminate this Agreement unless (a) AIG significantly modifies        the corporate structure or ownership of the Company, or (b) AIG sells        the Company to an acquirer (i) having a rating from at least one of S&P,        Moody's, A.M. Best or a substitute agency, which is a nationally        recognized statistical rating organization, that is at least equal to        the lower of (x) AIG's then-current rating from such agency or (y) the        Company's then-current rating as supported by this Agreement from such        agency; or (ii) such that, immediately on the effective date of the sale        by AIG of the Company, the Company's capitalization is consistent with        the minimum capital adequacy standards and criteria of at least one of        S&P, Moody's, A.M. Best or a substitute agency, which is a nationally        recognized statistical rating organization, for a rating that is equal        to or better than the Company's then-current rating on the date        immediately preceding such sale.
perturbation.changed_text: AIG shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon five (5) days' prior written notice to the Company, which notice shall state the effective date of termination. AIG may terminate this agreement at will for any reason.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period to five days and removing conditions for termination contradicts the implicit regulatory expectations for stability and predictability in capital maintenance agreements within the insurance sector. A sudden termination without cause could potentially undermine the Company's financial stability, leading to regulatory concerns.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Delaware Insurance Code related to regulatory oversight of material agreements impacting insurer solvency and financial stability.

perturbation.original_text: Any policyholder holding a policy issued by the Company prior to the        termination of this Agreement shall have the right to demand that the        Company enforce the Company's rights under paragraphs 1, 4 and 5 of this        Agreement, and, if the Company fails or refuses to take timely action to        enforce such rights or the Company defaults in any claim or other        payment owed to any such policyholder when due, such policyholder may        proceed directly against AIG to enforce the Company's rights under        paragraphs 1, 4 and 5 of this Agreement; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, that no policyholder of the Company may        take any action authorized under this paragraph 9 unless and until        (a) such policyholder has given AIG written notice of its intent to        enforce the terms of this Agreement as provided in this paragraph 9,        which notice shall specify in reasonable detail the nature of and basis        for the policyholder's complaint and (b) AIG has failed to comply with        this Agreement within sixty (60) days after such notice is given
perturbation.changed_text: Any policyholder holding a policy issued by the Company prior to the termination of this Agreement shall have the right to demand that the Company enforce the Company's rights under paragraphs 1, 4 and 5 of this Agreement, and, if the Company fails or refuses to take timely action to enforce such rights or the Company defaults in any claim or other payment owed to any such policyholder when due, such policyholder may proceed directly against AIG to enforce the Company's rights under paragraphs 1, 4 and 5 of this Agreement; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, that no policyholder of the Company may take any action authorized under this paragraph 9 unless and until (a) such policyholder has given AIG written notice of its intent to enforce the terms of this Agreement as provided in this paragraph 9, which notice shall specify in reasonable detail the nature of and basis for the policyholder's complaint and (b) AIG has failed to comply with this Agreement within fifteen (15) days after such notice is given
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that policyholders must give AIG 60 days to comply with the agreement before taking action. Shortening that compliance period to 15 days might not provide AIG enough time to address the concerns, potentially increasing litigation risks for policyholders and creating issues with 'good faith' requirements in legal proceedings.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of contract law related to reasonable notice and opportunity to cure breaches, as well as potential conflicts with state-specific regulations around insurance claim handling practices and fair claims settlement.
